conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, and C change in position and size when the light source moves to the right above the objects.
Initial setup includes a birdcage (left), a small object (middle), and a knife (right) with shadows cast to the left side of the objects due to the light source.
The birdcage casts shadow A to the left, which is elongated and points to the left.
The small object casts shadow B to the left, which is elongated and points to the left.
The knife casts shadow C to the left, which is elongated and points to the left.
When the light source moves to the right, the direction of the shadows will reverse, and shadows will move to the right side of the objects instead of the left.
As the light source moves to the right, the shadows will become more compressed and less elongated due to the change in the angle of light.
The birdcage's shadow (A) will move to the right and become shorter.
The small object's shadow (B) will move to the right and become shorter.
The knife's shadow (C) will move to the right and become shorter.
Initially, shadows A, B, and C are on the left side of the objects.
When the light source moves to the right, shadows shift to the right side of the objects and become shorter and less elongated.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, and C will shift to the right side of the objects and become shorter when the light source moves to the right above the objects.
